meanings.definition: To write or provide an epilogue for a literary work.
meanings.sent1: After finishing the story, she enjoyed epiloguing to give it a proper ending.
meanings.sent2: Authors often spend time epiloguing their novels to tie up loose ends.
meanings.sent3: The writer couldn't resist epiloguing with a surprise twist at the end.
meanings.sent4: Her epiloguing added a layer of depth to the narrative, like a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: Epiloguing can make a story more satisfying for the reader, like a dessert after a meal.

meanings.definition: The act of adding an epilogue to a story or play.
meanings.sent1: The epiloguing of the play provided closure for the audience.
meanings.sent2: A well-crafted epiloguing can leave a lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The epiloguing of the story was unexpectedly humorous, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His epiloguing was like a final stroke of paint on a masterpiece, completing the picture.
meanings.sent5: The epiloguing of the tale was so poignant that it stayed with the listeners long after.
